product.comment: A CafePress product is a type of merchandise customized with a user's designs. Completed products are sellable.
product.name: Baseball Jersey
product.description:
Our 100% cotton Baseball Jersey is a sporty hit with both men and women whether you're in the game or just looking the part in great run-around casual-wear. Choose red, blue or black sleeves.
  • 6.1 oz. 100% heavyweight cotton
  • Standard fit
  • 3/4 length contrasting raglan sleeves
product.comment: Represents one of the available colors of a type of merchandise. Product definitions may limit what colors are available for sale and specify a default.
Represents one of the available sizes of a type of merchandise.
The unique numeric identifier of the product. And id of 0 indicates a new product. Upon successfully saving a new product, the product definition will be returned with an assigned id.
The name of the product.
The id of the merchandise of this product. Products are merchandise configured with designs. The merchandise id cannot be changed for a particular product after the product is saved.
The price of the product in the product owner's store. sellPrice must be equal to or greater than the base price.
The marketplace price of the product based on its underlying merchandise merchandise.
The currency of the prices shown. Currency is determined by the location of the host location of the downloading or by using the location parameter to specify a location.
The currency code of the prices shown. Currency is determined by the location of the host location of the downloading or by using the location parameter to specify a location.
The currency symbol of the prices shown. Currency is determined by the location of the host location of the downloading or by using the location parameter to specify a location.
The editable description of the product.

The read-only memberId of the product. A product may only belong to one CafePress member (i.e. user/shopkeeper.) The member id of a product can only change if the product is transfered from an anonymous member to a real member. See authentication.transferAnonymousUser.cp

The alpha-numeric storeId of the product. A product may be assigned to any store of the owning member, provided store quoata levels are not reached. The storeId should be left 0 omitted for anonymous users. If omitted a storeId will default to the first Create & Buy store (a store with isSelfBuy="true"), or one will be created if it does not exist.
The name of the store referenced by storeId. This is here for convenience. Use store.findStore.cp for full store data.

The numeric store sectionId of the product. A product may be assigned to any section of the given storeId, provided store quoata levels are not reached. A sectionId of 0 indicates that the product should go in the top-level section of the store, which always has a sectionId of 0.
The name of the section referenced by sectionId. This is here for convenience. Use store.findStoreSection.cp for full section data.

The string identifier of the default orientation of a product. This attribute only matters for products of merchandise that have multiple options for how a design is applied to a media region (e.g. horizontal or vertical.) Product with multiple orientations will list orientation options in the merchandise and product definitions.
The numeric size identifier of the default size of a product.

The default perspective of the underlying merchandise. This denotes what perspective is shown by the defaultProductUri. Only merchandise with front and back perspectives can be set. Other merchandise, such as calendars, are read-only.

The base price of the underlying merchandise. The base price is the minimum sellPrice you can set for a product. Be aware that some product options, notably extra large sizes, can increase the final sell price of the product.
The short descripton of the underlying merchandise.
The description of the underlying merchandise.
The short description of the underlying merchandise, limited to 50 characters.
The category id of the underlying merchandise.
The category caption of the underlying merchandise.
The current availability of the underlying merchandise. See stockAvailabilityId for the values.

The numeric id indicating the current availability of the underlying merchandise. The values are as follows: 1 In Stock., 2 In Stock, will ship in 2-3 business days (shipped separately), 5 Immediate electronic delivery, 100 No Longer Available, 101 Temporarily Out of Stock, will ship in 2-3 weeks, 102 Not Available for Individual Purchase, 103 Temporarily Out of Stock, 107 Pre-Order, this item will ship in 2-3 weeks. Your order will not be shipped until this item is available., 110 For Design Only, Not For Sale, 111 Will ship in 5-6 business days. All Custom Postage orders are subject to image review by Stamps.com.Please Note - We cannot guarantee delivery time for Stamps., 112 Dark Apparel will ship in a minimum of 5 business days., 113 In stock. Usually ships within 3-5 business days., 114 In Stock, will ship in 5 business days, 115 No Longer Available/Non Reportable, 116 In Stock, will ship in 2 business days, 117 In stock, will ship in 2-3 business days. Note: Matte paper is on back-order and will ship in 1 week., 118 Available immediately
The string based on the underlying merchandise indicating limitations on creating products of the merchandise. See merchandiseAvailabilityStatusId for the values.

The read-only numeric id based on the underlying merchandise indicating limitations on creating products of the merchandise. The values are as follows (Premium indicates premium shops only): 0 Not available to add, 1 Premium Item, 2 Limited Edition Item, 3 All Stores | Permanent Item

The default URI to render an image of the product. This URI is based on the default perspective and default color (if applicable.) Designs assigned to the media configurations in the default perspective will appear.

The URI to render an image of the product. This URI places CSS-style wildcards in place of the perspective and color (if applicable) to allow you to replace the wildcard with one of the available values of your choice. The wildcard tells you where to find the possible values in the product XML (e.g. (color id) means look at the color elements and chose one of the id attributes.)
A URL showing the product on its marketplace page.
A URL showing the product on its store page.
The property representing the number of available photos of the underlying merchandise.
The property that returns true if the underlying merchandise is any type of calendar.
This is true if the underlying merchandise is a book. Books are not fully supported by the API. Though typical properties can be listed, no book-specific data is available.
This is true if the underlying merchandise is a CD. CDs are not fully supported by the API. Though typical properties can be listed, no CD-specific data is available.
This is true if the underlying merchandise is an Audio CD. CDs are not fully supported by the API. Though typical properties can be listed, no CD-specific data is available.
This is true if the underlying merchandise is any type of poster.
A legacy property. For internal use only.
A legacy property. For internal use only.

The sort value of a product within its store and section between 0 and 100 inclusive, where 100 is highest. If the value is set to the same value as another product in the store or section, the two products relative ordering will be nondeterministic.
Indicates whether a product is complete and is thus sellable. Products are complete when they contain all required media configurations have designs.

color.comment: Represents one of the available colors of a type of merchandise. Product definitions may limit what colors are available for sale and specify a default.
color.name: Black/White
color.comment: The unique id of the color, unique accross all merchandise.
The name of the color, unique within the merchandise.
Indicates if the color is the default color for the merchandise
A URL showing a swatch of the color.

size.comment: Represents one of the available sizes for the merchandise.
size.name: Small

perspective.comment: Perspectives describe available views of a product, which correspond directly to the perspectives of the underlying merchandise. Perspective definitions offer URLs use to visualize the product for the given perspective. Wildcard URLs are also offered which allow you insert the color and/or or orientation for the product when applicable. The wildcards follow CSS formatting to indicate where in the product XML definition you can find the applicable values
perspective.name: Front
perspective.label: F
perspective.comment: A URL showing the product with this perspective. The URL may have a wildcard placeholder for the color indicated by (color id) if the merchandise supports multiple colors.
The name of the perspective, unique within the merchandise.
The width in pixels of the perspective rendering.
The height in pixels of the perspective rendering.
The sort order of the perspective relative to others.

Indicates whether the mediaConfigurations of products corresponding to the mediaRegions in this perspective can receive a design. Most mediaConfigurations can hold designs but a few are limited to special sales channels.
Indicates the default mediaRegion for this perspective, meaning the corresponding mediaConfiguration is the default mediaConfiguration used by the web site designer.
A label used in creating the URL of the for the perspective.

mediaConfiguration.comment: MediaConfiguration represents a placement of a design on a product. All products have one or more mediaConfigurations. MediaConfigurations correspond one-to-one to the mediaRegions of the product's merchandise. If more mediaConfigurations are given a design id than is supported by the underlying merchandise, then only the certain designs will appear on the product. When saving a product, it is only necessary to specify mediaConfigurations to which you are applying a design id. You can save a product without assigning designs to media configurations. Certain products, like calendars, are not sellable until all of the mediaConfigurations have a design.
mediaConfiguration.name: BackCenter
mediaConfiguration.comment: The DPI of the media configuration based on the size of the design assigned to the media configuration.

comment.defaultValue: 0, forces the largest possible size for the design.

mediaConfiguration.comment: The assignable height in inches that the design should occupy of the mediaConfiguration. In most cases you can leave this value unassigned to maximize the design with the mediaConfiguration. However, if you want the design to take up a smaller part of the mediaConfiguration area, you can set the value lower than that of the corresponding merchandise.mediaRegion.height. Note that if the design's aspect ratio does not match that of the mediaConfiguration's, based on corresponding merchandise.mediaRegion, then the mediaConfiguration height and width will shrink to match the design's aspect ratio. For example if the dimensions of a poster's mediaRegion is 10 inches wide by 8 inches high, and your design is 1000 pixels by 1000 pixels and the mediaConfiguration is 100 DPI (i.e. the design is 10 inches by 10 inches), then mediaConfiguration's size will be reduced to 8 inches by 8 inches to accomodate the full square design. If the design does not occupy the entire media region, such as in this case, then the alignment of the design will depend on the corresponding merchandise.mediaRegion.defaultAlignment property. You may reduce the mediaConfiguration height to the minimum designated by the corresponding merchandise.mediaRegion.minimumHeight. If you set the height too large it will be maximized to the greatest possible height, and likewise too small a height will be minimized.

The width in inches of the design with the mediaConfiguration in ratio to the height property. Only the height can be set. The width is calculated given the height and the media configuration's DPI and other constraints. See height.
The name of the mediaConfiguration, corresponding to one of the underlying merchandise's mediaRegions.
The id of the design assigned to the mediaConfiguration. The design id can be updated to any id belong to the owner of the product.

The alignment of the design within the merchandise's mediaRegion. Most merchandise only has one possible value. Cylindrical merchandise like mugs have 9 possible values. See the product's corresponding merchandise definition for the defaultAlignmnetThe possible values are TopLeft, TopCenter, TopRight, MiddleLeft, MiddleCenter, MiddleRight, BottomLeft, BottomCenter, BottomRight.
Indicates whether this mediaConfiguration can receive a design. Most mediaConfigurations can hold designs but a few are limited to special sales channels.
Lists perspectives that show this mediaConfiguration

productImage.comment: Represents a particular rendering of a product, by perspective, color, and image size. Color is optional. All attributes are read-only
The unique id of the color of those available for the underlying merchandise.
The unique name of a perspective of the underlying merchandise.
The size in pixels of the width and height of the image.
The URL of the product image.
